Text: I‚Äôm praying for the people of Ukraine and a diplomatic solution to this crisis because war is a poverty of thought.

#PresidentsDay was first observed as a federal holiday in 1885 in celebration of George Washington‚Äôs birthday.

Today we celebrate the holiday by reflecting on all of America's leaders who have guided us through our greatest challenges.
This month and all year, I‚Äôm committed to passing legislation rooted in justice and equity.

#BlackHistoryMonth is a time to honor the achievements of Black Americans throughout our history. As we celebrate, we also must reckon with America‚Äôs dark history of injustice by recommitting to ending systemic racism that remains with us today.
President Biden has the historic opportunity to appoint a woman to head @WHOSTP, and he should act quickly on that opportunity.

Women have made countless advances in science, technology, engineering and math, yet no president has appointed a permanent Science Advisor and @WHOSTP Director who is a woman.

It‚Äôs time for that to change.

#ARPAH ‚Äì the Advanced Research Projects Agency for Health ‚Äì presents a unique opportunity to take a major leap forward in biomedical sciences by funding high-risk, high-reward innovation that will improve the quality of life for all.

It is my top priority in Congress. https://t.co/FU5AzYTQw7

The documented mistreatment of staff by Dr. Eric Lander clearly does not meet the high standards set by the President. While Dr. Lander‚Äôs brilliance as one of our nation‚Äôs top scientists is unquestioned, his decision to step down as Director of OSTP is the right one.
The White House informed me that Dr. Eric Lander will not be testifying at the Health Subcommittee tomorrow. The hearing will proceed with the second panel of witnesses.

Next week I will hold a hearing of the Health Subcommittee on #ARPAH, a new agency to accelerate biomedical innovation to develop transformative breakthroughs in how we detect and treat the deadliest diseases.

It‚Äôs time accelerate our efforts to conquer cancer.

#CancerMoonshot

As we work toward @POTUS' goal to reduce the cancer death rate by at least 50 percent over the next 25 years, this Caucus will play a critical role in raising awareness about the deadliest cancers and advocating for research funding to increase survival rates for these cancers.

Today I‚Äôm reminded of Dr. Martin Luther King Jr.‚Äôs words: ‚ÄúInjustice anywhere is a threat to justice everywhere.‚Äù As states across the nation enact laws to suppress the vote & manipulate votes cast, we must take action to end this injustice. We must protect our democracy. #MLKDay

19 states have enacted 34 laws to not only suppress the vote, but also to be able to manipulate votes cast.

Congress cannot allow these brazen attempts to upend the democratic process go unanswered.

We must protect the vote & guarantee fair & free elections. #WeWantVotingRights

I‚Äôm proud to have voted for The For The People Act and The John R. Lewis Voting Rights Advancement Act. Regardless of political affiliation, we can be on the right side of history by doing what‚Äôs in our hands to achieve - protect the vote and save our democracy.

The President was crystal clear what must be done about the existential threat before us. The Senate must pass The Freedom to Vote Act, and to do so in a 50/50 Senate, there has to be an exception to the filibuster. To protect our democracy, a simple majority vote is in order.

President Biden‚Äôs strong remarks today are a clarion call on what must be done to protect our fragile democracy. The vote is foundational to democracy and today, 19 states have passed laws to not only suppress the vote, but shockingly, to manipulate the votes that are cast. https://t.co/iawWMvCykd

Our work must be to strengthen our democracy, protect the franchise of all Americans, and strengthen our institutions.

And @January6thCmte must complete its investigation into who paid for, organized, and collaborated to overthrow our government so that this never happens again.

As we remember that day, I hold the officers who died protecting the citadel of our democracy in my prayers. They, their loved ones, and all those who so courageously defended our democracy have my unending gratitude.
January 6, 2021, will always be among the darkest days in the history of our country and it will remain with me all the days of my life. https://t.co/NsbdfBbOfr
